New Records: The Yankees are the first team to force a Game 5 when down 3-0 in a World Series since the Reds in 1970 against the Orioles.
Anthony Volpe delivered the ninth World Series grand slam in Yankees history, setting a record for a single playoffs with six grand slams MLB-wide.
Volpe became the second player with multiple extra-base hits and stolen bases in a World Series game, joining Eddie Collins from 1910.
Volpe became the first Yankee with a grand slam and multiple stolen bases in a game since Mickey Mantle in 1962.
Freddie Freeman became the first player to homer in Games 1, 2, 3, and 4 of a World Series.
Freeman has now homered in six consecutive World Series games, breaking a tie with George Springer.
Freeman's 10 RBIs this series are the most in a World Series in Dodgers history, passing Gil Hodges and Duke Snider.
Key Match Events: Anthony Volpe hit a grand slam in the third inning.
Volpe added an eighth-inning double to spark a five-run frame and had two stolen bases.
Austin Wells homered in the sixth inning.
Freddie Freeman hit a home run in the first inning.
Miscellaneous Highlights: 11 runs were the Yankees’ most in a World Series game since 1978 Game 5.
This was the fifth World Series game with homers from multiple catchers.
Freeman's 10 RBIs are the most in the first four games of a World Series.
